metadata.scope: Marketing materials for Digital Lending, Payment Systems, NBFCs, Payment Aggregators
metadata.citation_policy: All violations must include RBI document citation and section reference

digital_lending_marketing.title: Digital Lending Platform Marketing Disclosure Requirements
digital_lending_marketing.description: All digital lending marketing materials must display comprehensive fee structure and terms prominently
digital_lending_marketing.marketing_context: Applies to all advertisements, brochures, website content, app descriptions, social media posts for digital lending platforms
digital_lending_marketing.content: Digital lending platforms shall ensure that all fees, charges, interest rates, and other terms are disclosed prominently and transparently in all marketing communications before customer engagement.
required_marketing_elements: Link to detailed terms and conditions
prohibited_marketing_claims: Promises of instant approval without verification

digital_lending_marketing.title: Interest Rate Display in Digital Lending Marketing
digital_lending_marketing.description: All interest rate advertisements must show complete pricing information
digital_lending_marketing.marketing_context: Interest rate displays in ads, websites, brochures, promotional materials
digital_lending_marketing.content: Marketing materials displaying interest rates must show all-inclusive pricing including processing fees, and other charges as APR.
required_marketing_elements: All fees and charges included in calculation
prohibited_marketing_claims: Starting rates without showing maximum rates

citation.document: RBI Circular on Interest Rate Display
citation.title: Guidelines on Fair Practices Code for Lenders

payment_systems_marketing.title: Payment Security Claims in Marketing
payment_systems_marketing.description: Marketing materials must not make absolute security claims about digital payments
payment_systems_marketing.marketing_context: Payment app marketing, wallet advertisements, UPI service promotions
payment_systems_marketing.content: Payment service marketing must not make absolute security guarantees and must include appropriate disclaimers about digital payment risks.
prohibited_marketing_claims: Comparisons claiming superior security without proof

citation.document: Master Direction on Digital Payment Security Controls
citation.title: RBI Digital Payment Security Guidelines

payment_systems_marketing.title: Transaction Limit Disclosure in Marketing
payment_systems_marketing.description: Payment service marketing must clearly disclose transaction limits and restrictions
payment_systems_marketing.marketing_context: UPI apps, mobile wallets, payment gateway marketing materials
payment_systems_marketing.content: All marketing communications for payment services must clearly mention transaction limits, daily limits, and any restrictions.

payment_aggregator_marketing.title: Payment Aggregator Authorization Display
payment_aggregator_marketing.description: Payment aggregators must display RBI authorization status in marketing
payment_aggregator_marketing.marketing_context: Payment gateway marketing, merchant acquisition materials, B2B payment solutions
payment_aggregator_marketing.content: Payment aggregators must clearly mention their RBI authorization status in all marketing materials and cannot imply unauthorized services.
required_marketing_elements: Link to RBI authorized entity list

citation.title: Guidelines on Regulation of Payment Aggregators and Payment Gateways

nbfc_marketing.title: Microfinance Marketing and Customer Protection
nbfc_marketing.description: NBFC microfinance marketing must emphasize responsible lending and customer protection
nbfc_marketing.marketing_context: Microfinance advertisements, rural marketing, customer acquisition materials
nbfc_marketing.content: NBFC-MFI marketing materials must emphasize responsible lending practices and cannot use coercive or misleading language.

citation.document: Master Direction – Reserve Bank of India (Regulatory Framework for Microfinance Loans) Directions, 2022

nbfc_marketing.title: NBFC Investment Product Marketing
nbfc_marketing.description: Investment-focused NBFC marketing must include risk disclosures
nbfc_marketing.marketing_context: Investment product advertisements, wealth management marketing, portfolio services
nbfc_marketing.content: NBFCs offering investment products must include comprehensive risk disclosures and cannot guarantee returns in marketing.
required_marketing_elements: "Investments are subject to market risks" disclaimer
prohibited_marketing_claims: Comparison with bank deposits without risk disclosure

fair_practices_marketing.title: Fair Practices in Financial Services Marketing
fair_practices_marketing.description: All financial services marketing must follow fair practice principles
fair_practices_marketing.marketing_context: All FinTech marketing materials across products and services
fair_practices_marketing.content: Financial services marketing must be fair, transparent, and not misleading. Cannot exploit customer vulnerabilities or use unethical tactics.

customer_protection_marketing.title: Grievance Redressal Disclosure in Marketing
customer_protection_marketing.description: All FinTech marketing must include grievance redressal information
customer_protection_marketing.marketing_context: Mandatory disclosure in all marketing materials
customer_protection_marketing.content: All marketing materials must include accessible grievance redressal contact information and mention RBI complaint portal.

customer_protection_marketing.title: Data Privacy Disclosures in Marketing
customer_protection_marketing.description: Marketing materials mentioning data usage must include privacy disclosures
customer_protection_marketing.marketing_context: Marketing materials that reference customer data usage, AI/ML features, personalization
customer_protection_marketing.content: Any marketing content that mentions data collection, AI analysis, or personalized services must include data privacy disclosures.

comparative_marketing.title: Comparative Marketing Claims Standards
comparative_marketing.description: Comparative marketing claims must be factual, verifiable, and fair
comparative_marketing.marketing_context: Marketing materials comparing services with competitors
comparative_marketing.content: Comparative marketing claims must be substantiated with verifiable data and cannot be misleading or unfair to competitors.
